image.altText: A composite image of a man and woman talking to each other.

props.synopsis: Clare O'Neil accuses Michael Sukkar of speaking "absolute garbage" on social housing as 7.30 host Sarah Ferguson delivers an iconic live television moment.

title.children: Sukkar shut down during wild election housing debate

image.altText: Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton, now seriously on the back foot, has made an extraordinarily big "aspirational" commitment at the back end of this campaign.

title.children: Dutton's tax 'aspiration' is his most radical idea since nuclear power

image.altText: A close up of a Hesta sign on a wall.

props.synopsis: HESTA won't process super contributions, regular withdraws, investment switches and insurance claims until June, due to a system changeover. Consumer advocates and members have expressed concern about the freeze on funds.

title.children: One of Australia's biggest super funds is freezing services until June

image.altText: A man with long blonde hair speaks to someone out of frame

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's comments came after he indicated Beijing was keen to meet to discuss the tariff war the two countries are locked in.

title.children: Trump says 'very good' trade deal will be made with China

image.altText: Ramos Horta Timor leste reuters

props.synopsis: Timor-Leste's President Jose Ramos Horta has said his country's forces could join with China's as long as the activity is "not directed at any perceived hostile entity".

title.children: A close Australian neighbour is open to military drills with China

image.altText: A diver explores Opal Reef, which is part of the Great Barrier Reef.

props.synopsis: Striking historic drawings of the Great Barrier Reef found in an old, waterlogged book capture the spell this underwater world has put on people for centuries.

title.children: Alien structures and a sea monster: Dive into the Barrier Reef's enduring mystery

image.altText: A small baby's hand clutching the thumb of a parent.

props.synopsis: A Queensland Health spokesperson said early investigations suggested human error and a failure to follow processes were behind the Monash IVF mistake, which resulted in a patient being implanted with another woman's embryo.

title.children: Health regulator visits every Monash IVF clinic in Queensland after embryo mix-up

image.altText: Jerome Powell standing at a lectern with Donald Trump behind him.

props.synopsis: The president has placed the head of the US central bank in his sights, floating a move that could cause market chaos and undermine the independence of the Federal Reserve.

title.children: Trump says US Federal Reserve boss' termination 'cannot come fast enough'

props.synopsis: From Cairns to the Cape, Leichhardt is up for grabs with the departure of long-serving MP Warren Entsch. We go behind the scenes with the two candidates who want to fill his shoes.

title.children: Labor is pinning its hopes on a former NBL player to win the far north

image.altText: zelenskyy

props.synopsis: China has previously projected an image of neutrality on the Ukraine invasion, but has forged closer ties with Russia as the fighting as raged.

title.children: Ukraine accuses China of supplying weapons to Russia

image.altText: Rescue worker in neon green gear amidst dense forest foliage and branches, with a broken cable car window visible.

props.synopsis: A cable car carrying tourists south of Naples crashed on Thursday after the cable snapped, officials say. Sixteen passengers in a separate cabin that stopped mid-air had to also be evacuated.

title.children: Four killed and sixteen others rescued after cable car crash in Italy

image.altText: a cyclone tracking map

props.synopsis: The cyclone is expected to cross the coast on the Dampier Peninsula north of Broome as a category one system.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Errol expected to hit Kimberley coast as a category one system

image.altText: a man looking at the camera with glasses on

props.synopsis: Rocked by a coal-fired controversy, the LNP has been sent into damage control for the first time since its Queensland election win, writes Alex Brewster.

title.children: Blast from the past as Callide power plant presents first scandal for LNP

image.altText: A man stood on rocks on the edge of the ocean

props.synopsis: Australia's weather will be firing on all cylinders this Easter long weekend, with a cyclone in the north, powerful swell in the east and a swing from hot to cool in the south.

title.children: Easter weather brings a cyclone, swells and temperature whiplash

image.altText: Rory McIlroy on his knees

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A pop star in space, McIlroy's stirring win and mounds of rubbish

image.altText: An illustration of a side profile of a person with missing microchip piece against a backdrop of a microchip

props.synopsis: People are turning to AI chatbots for cheap or even free therapy but how does this compare to seeking a professional for help? Here's what the experts say.

title.children: Therapy chatbots have been around since the 60s — but how far can they go?

image.altText: A man on a horse carrying a whip tries to stop three other horses running away

props.synopsis: Rangers are scouring Victoria's high country for a horse that escaped handlers during a re-enactment of Banjo Patterson's Man From Snowy River poem.

title.children: Horse still missing a week after Man From Snowy River re-enactment goes awry

image.altText: Two nuclear power buildings in the night.

props.synopsis: The Coalition has sent voters contradictory messages about whether it has accounted for the vast water requirements of its seven proposed nuclear plants after Peter Dutton declared the issue all but resolved.

title.children: Coalition sends mixed messages over nuclear power water needs

image.altText: a pope sitting in the passenger seat talking to journalists

props.synopsis: Asked how he was doing and marking this year's Easter season, Francis said in a weak voice: “I am living it as I can.”

title.children: Pope Francis visits Rome prison despite doctors' orders to take it easy

image.altText: old woman in pink top with neutral expression standing on a school crossing

props.synopsis: The longtime primary school crossing guard wins an unfair dismissal case against a regional Victorian council that sacked her due to a disputed knee injury.

title.children: Council's sacking of 86yo lollipop lady found to be unfair

image.altText: A fair-haired boy works at a desk in a home office.

props.synopsis: Dustin's mum says he is "just a normal bush kid", but the 12-year-old has been unable to enrol in school due to his autism.

title.children: Boarding schools urged to make room for bush students with autism

image.altText: Anna looks to the left while sitting in an empty snowy plain with a hill behind her, wearing a parka.

props.synopsis: North of North is a comedy filmed in the Arctic, but that's not the only reason it's unlike any other show on TV.

title.children: North of North is set in the Arctic but will make you feel warm and fuzzy

image.altText: King Charles in a tweed suit smiling alongside Queen Camilla in a blue jacket and red beret

props.synopsis: King Charles III is set to attend the Church of England's annual Maundy Thursday service and says there are three virtues the world in 2025 still needs: 'faith, hope and love'.

title.children: King Charles reflects on war and heroism in annual Easter message

image.altText: Federal shadow minister for Indigenous Australians Jacinta Price standing and speaking outside a voting centre.

props.synopsis: Lisa Siebert has called for the Liberal Party's proposed royal commission into child sexual abuse in Indigenous communities to be expanded to all Australian children.

title.children: Coalition candidate diverges from Jacinta Price on royal commission call

image.altText: Four Taliban fighters ride in the back of a car in the darnkess, holding assault rifles

props.synopsis: The court's ruling on a request by Russia's Prosecutor General's Office followed last year's adoption of a law stipulating that the official designation as a terrorist organisation could be suspended by a court.

title.children: Russian court removes Afghan Taliban from list of banned terrorist groups

image.altText: photographer stands in front of portrait of palestinian boy with no arms

props.synopsis: The World Press said the image "tells the story of one boy, but also of a wider war that will have an impact for generations."

title.children: Image of Gazan boy who lost both arms selected as press photo of the year

image.altText: An elderly woman standing on a boat.

props.synopsis: The oldest woman to sail solo around the world, Jeanne Socrates, still spends most of her days on the ocean with just birds and dolphins for company.

title.children: At 82, Jeanne is still charting a 'marvellous' solo life on the high seas

image.altText: A crowd of people walking along a street carrying shopping bags on an overcast day.

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate rose slightly in March, from 4 per cent to 4.1 per cent

title.children: Australia's unemployment rate picks up slightly in March, to 4.1pc

image.altText: A sign of the hospital's exterior saying 'Northern Beaches Hospital: entry'.

props.synopsis: A report by the NSW auditor-general reveals the hospital was not effectively delivering the best health services and clinical outcomes for the community.

title.children: Government rejected bid to take over troubled Sydney hospital, report says

image.altText: Gavin Newsom in a black shirt standing at a California state lectern raising both pointed index fingers while next to Rob Bonta

props.synopsis: The United States' most populous jurisdiction, California, and its Governor Gavin Newsom are suing the Trump administration in a lawsuit aimed at blocking President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs on foreign trading partners.

title.children: US' most-populous state files lawsuit against Trump's tariffs

image.altText: A foreign airline passenger is greeted by a Customs and Border Protection Officer at an immigration desk.

props.synopsis: Immigration lawyers provide advice on US travel, as border security officials conduct "enhanced vetting" of travellers with broad powers to refuse any visa holder entry.

title.children: Travelling to the US? Immigration lawyers suggest using a burner phone

image.altText: Bees on top of honeycomb.

props.synopsis: A pesticide called fipronil caused the deaths, but how the bees came into contact with it is yet to be established.

title.children: Investigation underway after 250,000 bees die in NSW town

image.altText: A hand holding two green avocados with blemishes over a pile of avocados.

props.synopsis: In the heart of WA's prime avocado growing region, a former engineer is turning formerly rejected fruit into sought-after oil.

title.children: Smashing use found for Australia's tonnes of wasted avocados

image.altText: A graphicised image shows a number of endangered and exotic animals like chimpanzees and tigers in a collage.

props.synopsis: Conservationists and journalists say they’re being threatened with legal action after raising questions about the impact of India's largest zoo.

title.children: We asked 30 experts about this zoo. Most of them declined an interview
